summary: The Strengthening Essential Manufacturing and Industrial Investment Act (SEMI Investment Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the advanced manufacturing investment credit. It focuses on semiconductor manufacturing, defining "advanced manufacturing facility" to include facilities manufacturing semiconductors, semiconductor manufacturing equipment, and, crucially, semiconductor materials. The bill provides detailed definitions for “direct” and “indirect” production materials used in semiconductor manufacturing, specifying examples and tasking the Secretary with publishing a comprehensive list of qualifying materials.  It aims to incentivize investment in semiconductor production.
